doc.after: Most park visitors sightsee using the scenic drive, which provides access to 13 viewpoints over the amphitheaters. Bryce Canyon has eight marked and maintained hiking trails that can be hiked in less than a day (round trip time, trailhead):[23] Mossy Cave (one hour, State Route 12 northwest of Tropic), Rim Trail (5â6 hours, anywhere on rim), Bristlecone Loop (one hour, Rainbow Point), and Queens Garden (1â2 hours, Sunrise Point) are easy to moderate hikes. Navajo Loop (1â2 hours, Sunset Point) and Tower Bridge (2â3 hours, north of Sunrise Point) are moderate hikes. Fairyland Loop (4â5 hours, Fairyland Point) and Peekaboo Loop (3â4 hours, Bryce Point) are strenuous hikes. Several of these trails intersect, allowing hikers to combine routes for more challenging hikes.
